Simsapāvana：1．Simsapāvana． A grove in Alavi，where the Buddha stayed in the Gomagga and was visited byHatthaka of Alavi．A．i．136．

2．Simsapāvana． A grove in Kosambī，where the Buddha once stayed．See Simsapa sutta．S．v．437．

3．Simsapāvana． A grove to the north of Setavyā，where Kumāra Kassapa once stayed．TheBuddha also once stayed there during a journey （DhA．i．59）．It was the scene of the preaching of the Pāyāsi Sutta．D．ii．316．

Simsapāvana Vagga． The fourth chapter of the Sacca Samyutta．S．v．437ff．
